intro: Mentzelia ctenophora, commonly known as the silkyleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open habitats. Mentzelia ctenophora is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is known for its ecological importance to pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
